CF23C1CEF6874A29AD22129821553B6F.description:
evaluate informational media using the teachings of the
Catholic faith

B653377FCDD041ACA50737AE0CA60529.description: use a range of strategies to interpret visual media

use appropriate content, conventions for purpose, audience,
occasion and context

6745D728D2A844A986668B5F6D96D7CC.description: recognize the role of response in oral communication

9984ED02ED054133A5361CF880951432.description:
participate appropriately in one-on-one situations and group
settings

1B845FEBB4E54100AB486FF0DC77689B.description: considers audience and variables in a speaking situation

4415A3F2C3D34DB9AE1229E0E9C08F4E.description: follow one and two step directions

C2C6B947CFC04B1F8B934CE40DC176CC.description: use complete sentences when orally communicating with others

6C1631010BE24FF1A938C6CE6561A98A.description:
classify information by constructing categories, for exampleliving
and non-living things

BEF18DDECDF546138731DCD67976CF28.description:
recognize that information can be found in non-print sources,
for example – videos, television, films, radio and the internet

CA60DC475F824DA6A0A336ED16A0209F.description:
recognize that information can be found in print sources, for
example – books, pictures, simple graphs and charts

49084281F6804696959863FE7CD40D6A.description: generate how and why questions about a topic of interest

CFE76B12C951438CADE0564B29851BA4.description:
The student will begin to access and use information from a
variety of sources.

80988E9E3A754F3E935883B0CC114524.description: use writing strategies for a variety of purposes

34D205A63408492FBF218624BDE2A7A2.description: use writing strategies for a variety of audiences

B2F24722BD4547A793255ED16B953F55.description:
use symbols (drawings, letters and words) to create written
pieces, for example – rhymes, to entertain others.

E734F7F1A6924A73A75054996AF2F410.description:
use symbols (drawings, letters and words) to create descriptions
of personal experiences, people, places or things

1017FA2450024C858E82E6ADC8A0A701.description:
use symbols (drawings, letters and words) to create narratives,
for example – stories and journal entries about people, places or
things

1024FF2590E6475AB797E8E321C24048.description:
use symbols (drawings, letters and words) to create written
communications, for example – notes, messages and lists, to
inform a specific audience

36D5F39441F446CFACE797900AD1B1CC.description:
The student will begin to write for a variety of purposes and
audiences.

6DB1A550DFF04498A2B22C356ED3A273.description:

revising and publishing

DFD02C72C2D04C338296DA375E182524.description: apply knowledge of high frequency words in writing

9393227E5A584D86AEE63B46D880D00E.description: apply phonetic and conventional spelling patterns in writing

F5169BA2E5884088AB80AE6111643772.description: show understanding of spaces between words

6B871FF444F34D658D873FCFA4C1E1EB.description:
experiment and create sentences and a variety of sentence
patterns

BA91A31B23F44DBAB1D6B08BA3E2A161.description: apply descriptive words to create images

42B12B42C6E543E49826E3CB3E818837.description:
write and draw to communicate a personal perspective and
feeling

2935CEDDD1754D50B776F28383A7D8FC.description:

intended meaning

1D51C6FFBD544803BC66299A45D5F2AE.description: use appropriate and legible letter formation when printing

C614CF56A030418C892722E98CA1E744.description: edit writing with a group, individually or with teacher support

39C3E3E5446249CF9A0666DA46D82B60.description: understand that a person’s name is a proper noun

0048D807BF884783878701910C9487D8.description: use letter and relationships to sounds to write words

use pictures, letters or words to tell a story from beginning to
end

94045432FA3146FBA497EC0950E21FF6.description:

conversations

7B78BECB15E14E21B168DF887DC885E4.description:
The student will begin to create written work that has a
clear focus, sufficient detail, coherent organization, effective
use of voice and correct use of the conventions of written
Standard American English.

19243E030EC74365ADE480018B4136E4.description:
carry out left-to-right and top-to-bottom directionality on the
printed page

C763914FDC8547728E71A1F78516CF6C.description:

2472A160BE804C6AA7618BBCD7F0E682.description:

from texts

9E1595CAF8A447518816705C693204FD.description: apply strategies to identify unknown words

65A47C9ED457474DBDA8206D2F247993.description:

4083294E9E43406FB3E800232161D28B.description: use appropriate voice level when speaking

20A186683E23437BA738909F62345E20.description: understand that small words can make compound words

The student will learn to read by applying appropriate skills

B36460FF073041F9A4951DD6CCB3CBB8.description: find facts in texts read aloud

summarize main idea and details from informational texts read

informational texts in print and non-print formats.

8005C57582734559A9716CFCF514DBFF.description: relate real-life experiences to the text

71B58A1589B3404E8DE2D19CCBD34CE9.description: explain the cause of an event in stories read aloud
